Description: Gold disc; stamped with rays diverging from centre; silver loop attached for suspension; piece of jewellery.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Town (Naukratis), Found by locals looting the site between 1884-5 “south-west of the town at a high part, lying in the loose dust among the houses”
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (3119)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 43-4, pl. XXVII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (QB.08)
